Submodules

prml.approximate_inference module

Approximate Inference

This module is about chapter10. VariationalGauss1D, VariationalGaussianMixture, VariationalLogisticRegression are implemented.

class prml.approximate_inference.VariationalGauss1D(a=0, b=0, mu=0, lamda=0, max_iter=1000, threshold=0.01)

Bases: object

approximately predict posterior distribution for gaussian

a,b

parameter for posterior distibution

Type

float

mu,lamda

parameter for posterior distibution

Type

float

max_iter

max iteration

Type

int

threshold

threshold

Type

float

fit(X, init_tau=1.0)
Parameters

  • X (1-d array) – data

  • init_tau (float) – initial value for E_tau

class prml.approximate_inference.VariationalGaussianMixture(K, alpha=None, m=None, beta=1, W=None, nu=None, n_iter=1000)

Bases: object

approximately predict posterior distribution for gaussian mixture

n_sample = N n_components = K n_dim = D (expressed as M in fit())

K

number of components

Type

int

alpha

shape = (K),param of posterior distribution of pi

Type

1-D array

beta

shape = (K),param of posterior distribution of mu and Lamda

Type

1-D array

m_k

shape = (K,D),param of posterior distribution of mu and Lamda

Type

2-D array

W_k

shape = (K,D,D),param of posterior distribution of mu and Lamda

Type

3-D array

nu

shape = (K),param of posterior distribution of mu and Lamda

Type

1-D array

n_iter

number of iteration

Type

int

r

shape = (N,K),responsibility for data X (after fit() is called)

Type

2-D array

fit(X, initial_responsibility=None, reduce_components=False, threshold=0.001)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – shape = (N_samples,N_dim),

  • initial_responsibility (2-D array), shape = (N_samples,K) initial respontibility (which should be normalized) –

  • reduce_components (bool) – if E_pi < threshold, that components will be reduced

  • threshold (float) – threshold for reducing, this param is used when reduce_components = True

prob_density(X)

predictive density is a mixture of student’s t-distributions

Parameters

X (2-D array) – shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

Returns

length = N_samples, which is the probability of predictive density

Return type

1-D array

class prml.approximate_inference.VariationalLogisticRegression(alpha=0.1, max_iter=100, threshold=0.01, basis_function='gauss', mu=None, s=None, deg=None)

Bases: prml.linear_classifier._logistic_regression_base

m_0 = 0 S_0 = alpha^-1 * I

alpha

param for prior distribution for weight

Type

float

xi

variational param

Type

1-D array

a,b

param for posterior density for alpha

Type

float

weight

mean of posterior density of weight

Type

1-D array

S

std of posterior density of weight

Type

2-D array

max_iter

max iteration for parameter optimization

Type

int

threshold

threshold for optimizint parameters

Type

float

fit(X, y, init_xi=None, optimize_param=False, init_a=0, init_b=0)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – data, shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • y (1-D array or 2-D array) – if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. should be 2-class data.

  • init_xi (1-D array) – initial param for xi (variational param)

  • optimize_param (bool) – if alpha will be optimized or not

  • init_a (float) – initial param for a,b

  • init_b (float) – initial param for a,b

predict(X, return_prob=False)
Parameters

  • X (2-D arrray) – shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • return_prob (bool) – if True, return probability

Returns

if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. This depends on parameter y when fitting.

If return_prob == True, always return probability of belonging to class1 in each record

Return type

1-D array or 2-D array

prml.combining_models module

combining models

This module is about chapter14. AdaBoost, CARTRegressor, CARTClassifier, LinearMixture, LogisticMixture are implemented.

prml.continuous_latent_variables module

Type

fit(X, M, find_M=False, alpha_limit=10)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – shape = (N_samples,N_dim), data

  • M (int) – dimension of latent variables

  • find_M (bool) – if appropriate M will be found or not, if this is True, appropriate_M <= M

  • alpha_limit (float) – if alpha is more than this, this component is removed

fit_transform(X, M, find_M=False, alpha_limit=10)

after this method is called, attribute W,sigma can be used

Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – shape = (N_samples,N_dim), data

  • M (int) – number of principal component, M is less than X.shape[1]

  • find_M (bool) – if appropriate M will be found or not, if this is True, appropriate_M <= M

  • alpha_limit (float) – if alpha is more than this, this component is removed

Returns

shape = (N_samples,M), projected data

Return type

2-D array

transform(X)
Parameters

X (2-D array) – shape = (N_samples,N_dim), data

Returns

shape = (N_samples,M), projected data

Return type

2-D array

Note

unlike other method you should choose M when you call fit()

prml.kernel_func module

Kernel function

LinearKernel, GaussianKernel, SigmoidKerne, RBFKernel, ExponentialKernel, GramMatrix are implemented

class prml.kernel_func.BaseKernel

Bases: abc.ABC

class prml.kernel_func.ExponentialKernel(theta=1)

Bases: prml.kernel_func.BaseKernel

Exponential Kernel

Exponential Kernel : k(x,y) = exp(-theta|x - y|)

class prml.kernel_func.GaussianKernel(sigma=0.1)

Bases: prml.kernel_func.BaseKernel

Gaussian Kernel

Gaussian Kernel : k(x,y) = exp(-|x-y|^2/2sigma^2)

class prml.kernel_func.GramMatrix(kernel='Linear', sigma=0.1, a=1.0, b=0.0, h=None, theta=1.0)

Bases: object

Gram Matrix

For making gram matrix. kernel type is

LinearKernel GaussianKernel SigmoidKernel RBFKernel ExponentialKernel

kernel_func

kernel_function

Type

function

class prml.kernel_func.LinearKernel

Bases: prml.kernel_func.BaseKernel

Linear Kernel

Linear Kernel : k(x,y) = x^Ty

class prml.kernel_func.RBFKernel(h)

Bases: prml.kernel_func.BaseKernel

RBF Kernel

RBF Kernel : k(x,y) = h(|x - y|)

class prml.kernel_func.SigmoidKernel(a=1, b=0)

Bases: prml.kernel_func.BaseKernel

Sigmoid Kernel

Sigmoid Kernel: k(x,y) = tanh(ax^Ty + b)

class prml.kernel_method.NadarayaWatson(g)

Bases: object

When X_tr,t is training data, and x is test data, predicted y is expressed as

y = sum_n k(x,X_tr[n])t_n k(x,X_tr[n]) = g(|x-X_tr[n]|) / sum_m g(|x-X_tr[m]|)

fit(X, y)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – explanatory variable,shape = (N_samples,N_dim)

  • y (2-D array) – target variable, shape = (N_samples,1)

predict(X)
Parameters

X (2-D array) – data,shape = (N_samples,N_dim)

Returns

predicted value, shape = (N_samples,1)

Return type

2-D array

prml.linear_classifier module

Linear Classification Models

This module is about chapter4. LinearClassifier, Fisher1D, Fisher, Perceptron, GenerativeClassifier, LogisticRegression, MultiClassLogisticRegression, BayesianLogisticRegression are implemented.

class prml.linear_classifier.BayesianLogisticRegression(alpha=0.01, max_iter=30, threshold=0.01, learning_rate=0.01, basis_function='gauss', mu=None, s=None, deg=None)

fit(X, y)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – data, shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • y (1-D array or 2-D array) – if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. should be 2-class data.

Note

optimizing parameters in gradient descent method

predict(X, return_prob=False)
Parameters

  • X (2-D arrray) – shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • return_prob (bool) – if True, return probability

Returns

if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. This depends on parameter y when fitting.

If return_prob == True, always return probability of belonging to class1 in each record

1-D array or 2-D array

Returns

if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. This depends on parameter y when fitting.

If return_prob == True, always return probability of belonging to class1 in each record

Return type

1-D array or 2-D array

fit(X, y, optimize_evidence=False, max_iter=20, threshold=0.001)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – explanatory variable,shape = (N_samples,N_dim)

  • y (1-D array) – target variable, shape = (N_samples)

  • optimize_evidence (bool) – if True, alpha and beta are optimized

  • max_iter (int) – number of max iteration for optimizing parameter

  • threshold (float) – if error is lower than this, stop iteration

prml.probability_distribution module

Probability Distribution

This module is about chapter2. Binary, Multi, Gaussian1D, student’s t-distribution, Histgram, Parzen, KNearestNeighbor, KNeighborClassifier are implemented.

class prml.probability_distribution.Binary(a=3, b=3)

Bases: object

Binary Variable

Bern(x|mu) = mu^x (1 - mu)^(1 - x) Beta(mu|a,b) = Gamma(a + b)/(Gamma(a)Gamma(b)) mu^(a - 1) (1 - mu)^(b - 1) estimate posterior distribution for mu

a

parameter for the beta distribution

Type

int

b

parameter for the beta distribution

Type

int

class prml.probability_distribution.Multi(K, alpha=None)

Bases: object

Multinomial Variables

p(oldsymbol{x}|oldsymbol{mu}) = Pi_{k=1}^K mu_k^{x_k} Dir(oldsymbol{mu}|oldsymbol{lpha}) =

rac{Gamma(lpha_0)}{Gamma(lpha_1) cdots Gamma(lpha_K)}Pi_{k=1}^K mu_k^{lpha_k-1}

Attributes:

K (int) : number of class alpha (1-D array) : parameter for dirichlet distributioin

fit(X)

Parameters

Bases: prml.sampling_methods.BaseSampling

sample data which follows D-dim gauss(mean=mu,std=sigma) if D = 1,mu=0,sigma=1 it is equal to BoxMuller

threshold

if error is lower than this, stop iteration

  • y (2-D array) – target variable, shape = (N_samples,1)

class prml.sparse_kernel_machines.SupportVectorMachineClassifier(C=20.0, eps=0.001, kernel='Linear', sigma=0.1, a=1.0, b=0.0, h=None, theta=1.0)

Bases: prml.kernel_method.BaseKernelMachine, prml.linear_classifier.Classifier

We use SMO algotithm for solving dual problem

C

if C is larger, misclassification on train data is not permitted.

Type

float

parameter for judging KKT condition is fulfilled

Note

This is based on https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/tr-98-14.pdf

fit(X, y)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – explanatory variable, shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • y (1-D array or 2-D array) – if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. should be 2-class data.

Return type

int

predict(X)
Parameters

  • X (2-D arrray) – shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • return_prob (bool) – if True, return probability

Returns

if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded. This depends on parameter y when fitting.

If return_prob == True, always return probability of belonging to class1 in each record

Return type

1-D array or 2-D array
